title: Man Arrested For Robbing PM Modi’s Niece Of Rs 56,000 & Phones In Delhi, Stolen Items Recovered
text:
There is no stop in the rising crimes in India, particularly in the national capital, where miscreants snatched the purse of the niece of Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

The incident took place in New Delhi’s Civil Lines area on Saturday. The incident, ANI reported, took place when Damayanti Ben Modi, the daughter of the Prime Minister's brother, was alighting from an auto-rickshaw outside the gates of Gujarati Samaj Bhavan in Civil Lines.

HINDUSTAN TIMES

Damayanti returned to Delhi from Amritsar today morning and had booked a room at the Gujarati Samaj Bhavan. She was to leave for Ahmedabad on the same evening.

But as the victim arrived at Civil Lines from Old Delhi Railway Station, the robbers came and snatched her purse after she got down from the auto-rickshaw, police said.

According to Damayanti, she had Rs 56,000 cash, two mobile phones and some important documents in the purse snatched by the robbers.

The crime spot was just a few kilometres away from the residences of Lieutenant Governor Anil Baijal and Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal.

The police said that Damayanti has filed a case of snatching and investigation is underway to nab the culprits.

REPRESENTATIONAL IMAGE. BCCL

"A case of snatching has been filed. We are analysing the CCTV footage from the railway station to Civil Lines. The investigation is underway and we will soon nab the accused," DCP (North) Monika Bhardwaj said.

The two bike-borne miscreants, who were involved in snatching the purse have been identified with the help of CCTV footage, Delhi Police said.

Both the accused are from Delhi, the police said, adding that one of the duo is suspected to be a minor. Later on Saturday, a man was arrested and Damayanti Ben's purse containing cash of Rs 50,000 and two mobile phones were recovered.

Several cases of snatching from various parts of the national capital have surfaced in recent times. In the list of high profile cases, a recent robbery at Union Minister Piyush Goyal’s Mumbai residence had recently surfaced. In the past, a robbery had also taken place at former minister and author Shashi Tharoor’s residence in the national capital.

With Inputs From Agencies
